cluster_classes.class_description: Quantities that characterize the spatial extent of a black hole, typically parameterized by the Schwarzschild radius. This class includes both the radius itself and derived notions of black hole size.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: black holes is their size, which is typically measured in terms of their Schwarzschild radius

members.entity_description: Characteristic radius around a black hole at which the escape velocity equals the speed of light, beyond which not even light can escape the gravitational pull.
Characteristic spatial extent of a black hole, often parameterized by its Schwarzschild radius.

cluster_classes.class_description: Speed-related quantities that define the kinematic condition at the Schwarzschild radius, where the escape velocity equals the speed of light.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Schwarzschild radius – the radius at which the escape velocity equals the speed of light

members.entity_description: The minimum speed required to escape a black hole’s gravitational influence at the Schwarzschild radius.
Fundamental physical constant representing the speed at which light propagates in vacuum.

args.new_description: Quantities that characterize the spatial extent of a black hole, typically parameterized by the Schwarzschild radius (event horizon radius), including the Schwarzschild radius itself and related measures of black hole size.
args.justification: This class cleanly represents geometric size measures of black holes built around the Schwarzschild radius; assigning it to a shared Class_Group with the kinematic condition class clarifies that both belong to the same conceptual domain while keeping their distinct roles.

args.new_description: Speed-related quantities and relations that define the kinematic condition at the Schwarzschild radius (event horizon), specifically the equality between escape velocity and the speed of light.
args.justification: This class captures the kinematic relation at the same Schwarzschild radius that underlies black hole size measures; placing it in the same Class_Group while preserving its distinct relational focus produces a coherent two-layer schema without unnecessary merging.

executed_decisions.justification: This class cleanly represents geometric size measures of black holes built around the Schwarzschild radius; assigning it to a shared Class_Group with the kinematic condition class clarifies that both belong to the same conceptual domain while keeping their distinct roles.

executed_decisions.justification: This class captures the kinematic relation at the same Schwarzschild radius that underlies black hole size measures; placing it in the same Class_Group while preserving its distinct relational focus produces a coherent two-layer schema without unnecessary merging.
